fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.config

Interface IConfigService


  • @SystemService
public interface IConfigService
    Gets the configuration service for the ViewShell environment. This includes path information for the filesystem and the HTTP service. Other (more specific) configuration information should be managed by relevant bundles using property stores (as provided by this service). Persistent configuration properties are stored in as XML properties files with UTF-8 encoding.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

      Fields

    • Method Detail

      • getHostVersion

        Version getHostVersion()
        Gets the version of the ViewShell host application, which will be equal to or less than the versions of active system bundles. It should in most cases be possible to upgrade system bundles without upgrading or even restarting the host application.
        Returns:
        the host version.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getHomePath

        String getHomePath()
        Gets the home path for ViewShell. This will contain configuration files, runtime data files, and caches and other temporary files. This path cannot be changed without restarting the application and the embedded OSGi framework.
        Returns:
        the home path, which will be a directory path (with a trailing directory separator).
        Since:
        1.0

      • toHomeSubfolderPath

        String toHomeSubfolderPath(String subfolderName)
        Returns an absolute path for the named direct subfolder, relative to VSH_HOME.
        Parameters:
        subfolderName - name of subfolder.
        Returns:
        absolute path, with a trailing directory separator, of the supplied relative subfolder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null, empty, or contains the directory separator character.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPluginBundlePath

        Returns:
        path, with a trailing directory separator, of the user bundle folder.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAssetsPath

        String getAssetsPath()
        Gets the absolute path for the parent directory of folders for media assets and theme packages. Media files and theme files each have their own sub-directories under this path.
        Returns:
        path, with a trailing directory separator, of the user deployment assets folder.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getSystemLogger

        org.slf4j.Logger getSystemLogger()
        Logger for system messages. Designed for tracing runtime information about internal components, including file access, flow processing, remote server access. Not intended for tracing messages directly related to incoming access to the embedded server.
        Returns:
        the system logger.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getUserLogger

        Returns:
        the user extension logger.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getServerEndPoint

        IHttpEndPoint getServerEndPoint()
        Embedded HTTP server endpoint settings.

        For incoming requests, this information may be different to what the end user provides, if for example requests are forwarded by a reverse proxy.

        Returns:
        the server endpoint, or null if incorrectly configured.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isServerUsingSessionCookies

        boolean isServerUsingSessionCookies()
        Embedded HTTP server option indicating whether sessions should try to use cookies.

        By default, for compliance with the European "e-Privacy" Directive 2009/136/EC, this feature is NOT enabled. You can however override this default setting if for example you are using ViewShell in an environment where cookies are known to be authorized.

        When session cookies are not used, URL rewriting should be used instead.

        This does not prevent any other use of cookies.

        Returns:
        true if the server should try to use cookies for session identifiers, otherwise false (the default setting).
        Since:
        1.0

      • getServerSessionTimeout

        int getServerSessionTimeout()
        Embedded HTTP server option indicating the maximum inactivity interval for user sessions, in seconds.

        By default, this is set to 30 minutes.

        Returns:
        the number of seconds before the session times out due to inactivity. If negative, indicates that no automatic timeout will occur.
        Since:
        1.0

      • createConfigUnit

        IConfigUnit createConfigUnit()
        Creates an in-memory (non persistent) configuration object.
        Returns:
        a configuration object.
        Since:
        1.0

      • createConfigUnit

        IConfigUnit createConfigUnit(Properties properties)
        Creates an in-memory (non persistent) configuration object, based on an existing set of properties. The returned configuration object will use a copy of the supplied properties. After creating the configuration object, any changes made to the supplied properties object will not be visible to the configuration object.
        Parameters:
        properties - non-null properties object to use during initialization. It is assumed that there will be no concurrent modifications to the properties object during invocation of this method.
        Returns:
        a configuration object.
        Since:
        1.0

      • createConfigStore

        IConfigStore createConfigStore(IConfigStoreEventListener configStoreEventListener,
                               IConfigServiceEventListener configServiceEventListener)
                        throws ConfigException
        Creates a default persistent configuration object, automatically identified by the symbolic name of the OSGi bundle requiring this service.

        When file-watching is enabled, on-disk changes to the file will be detected and applied to the configuration file automatically. If a non-null configStoreEventListener is provided, it will receive notifications of such external changes.

        When the configuration store enforces exclusive access, a second listener can be provided to receive notification when the configuration store becomes unlocked (when exclusive access is released).

        Parameters:
        configStoreEventListener - optional object to be notified when an external change occurs. May be null.
        configServiceEventListener - optional object to be notified when the configuration store becomes unlocked for exclusive access, if it is locked by another bundle instance when this method is invoked. The notification will be sent once at most, or never if the configuration store remains locked (or if the configuration service is disposed of before unlocking can occur). May be null.
        Returns:
        a persistent configuration object.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the default configuration name is invalid, in conflict, locked, or if some other I/O error occurs. If thrown due to the requested store being locked by another bundle, then the supplied configServiceEventListener will be registered for deferred notification of availability.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createAuxiliaryConfigStore(String, IConfigStoreEventListener, IConfigServiceEventListener), dropConfigStore()

      • createAuxiliaryConfigStore

        IConfigStore createAuxiliaryConfigStore(String auxiliaryId,
                                        IConfigStoreEventListener configStoreEventListener,
                                        IConfigServiceEventListener configServiceEventListener)
                                 throws ConfigException
        Creates a secondary persistent configuration object, automatically identified by the symbolic name of the OSGi bundle requiring this service and the auxiliary identifier.

        When file-watching is enabled, on-disk changes to the file will be detected and applied to the configuration file automatically. If a non-null configStoreEventListener is provided, it will receive notifications of such external changes.

        When the configuration store enforces exclusive access, a second listener can be provided to receive notification when the configuration store becomes unlocked (when exclusive access is released).

        Parameters:
        auxiliaryId - name of this secondary (non-primary) configuration object.
        configStoreEventListener - optional object to be notified when an external change occurs. May be null.
        configServiceEventListener - optional object to be notified when the configuration store becomes unlocked for exclusive access, if it is locked by another bundle instance when this method is invoked. The notification will be sent once at most, or never if the configuration store remains locked (or if the configuration service is disposed of before unlocking can occur). May be null.
        Returns:
        a persistent configuration object.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the default configuration name is invalid, in conflict, locked, or if some other I/O error occurs. If thrown due to the requested store being locked by another bundle, then the supplied configServiceEventListener will be registered for deferred notification of availability.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createConfigStore(IConfigStoreEventListener, IConfigServiceEventListener)

      • dropConfigStore

        void dropConfigStore()
              throws ConfigException
        Drops the reference to the persistent configuration object, and deletes the resources used for storage (such as a file), automatically identified by the symbolic name of the OSGi bundle requiring this service. Any monitoring and notification of external changes will be stopped.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if an error occurs when disposing of the configuration store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createConfigStore(IConfigStoreEventListener, IConfigServiceEventListener)

      • dropAuxiliaryConfigStore

        void dropAuxiliaryConfigStore(String auxiliaryId,
                              boolean delete)
                       throws ConfigException
        Drops the reference to a secondary persistent configuration object, and (if required) deletes the resources used for storage (such as a file), automatically identified by the symbolic name of the OSGi bundle requiring this service and by the auxiliary identifier. Any monitoring and notification of external changes will be stopped.
        Parameters:
        auxiliaryId - name of this secondary (non-primary) configuration object.
        delete - when true, the configuration service will delete any persistent resources used to store the configuration. When false, only references to the resources are dropped.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if an error occurs when disposing of the configuration store.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        createAuxiliaryConfigStore(String, IConfigStoreEventListener, IConfigServiceEventListener)

      • getConfigResource

        IConfigResource getConfigResource(String resourceName,
                                  ResourceType resourceType)
                           throws ConfigException
        Creates or retrieves a reference to a named configuration resource.

        Unlike configuration stores, the contents of configuration resources are not managed by ViewShell. Configuration resources are stored in the normal folder, with associated event handlers for notification of changes, and buffered updates to avoid clobbering a valid file when modifying the resources.

        This method is idempotent: calling it more than once with the same parameters will yield the same instance.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - the non-null name of the resource, which may contain alphanumeric ASCII characters, underscores, and hyphens.
        resourceType - the non-null type of the resource.
        Returns:
        the resource.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if an error occurs obtaining the instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getMediaType

        IMediaType getMediaType(String mediaType)
        Gets a media type for a MIME type string.
        Parameters:
        mediaType - the media type, such as text/html.
        Returns:
        the media type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the media type cannot be parsed.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMediaTypeForFile(String), getFileExtension(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs.IMediaType)

      • getMediaTypeForFile

        IMediaType getMediaTypeForFile(String fileName)
        Gets a media type for a file, based on the file's extension.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the non-null and non-empty file name.
        Returns:
        the media type, defaulting to "application/octet-stream" if no mapping is defined.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the file name is null, empty, or invalid.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMediaType(String), getFileExtension(fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs.IMediaType)

      • getFileExtension

        String getFileExtension(IMediaType mediaType)
        Gets a file extension associated with a media type.

        When multiple file extension mappings exist (such as "jpeg" and "jpg"), then the extension will be selected by sorting all matches using a string comparison algorithm, and then selecting the first match.

        When no matching extension is found, then the either the subtype or type will be used. If both the subtype and the type are wildcards, or where there is no specific subtype for an application type, or when mediaType is null, then a generic extension "data" is returned.

        Parameters:
        mediaType - the media type.
        Returns:
        the non-null best-match extension (as defined above). Does not include any preceeding "." character.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMediaTypeForFile(String), getMediaType(String)
